physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms G displayed symptoms of hopelessness, difficulty sleeping, emotional lability, decreased appetite, and decreased energy. She denied suicidal feelings or hallucinations. Her speech was pressured, and her thought processes were tangential. Affect was labile, and insight and judgment were rated as fair to poor.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Over time, Ms G discontinued medications and again became agitated, leading to a second inpatient stay.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: During her regular follow-up with the psychiatrist after her second hospitalization, she developed a major depressive episode and started treatment with bupropion in addition to divalproex.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: She felt frightened after her manic episode and second hospitalization, indicating an alteration in her course of life.
